words.definition: not perturbed or disconcerted
words.verbal-illustration: the protestors were unfazed by the prospect of arrest

words.definition: a child who behaves very badly : an annoying child
words.verbal-illustration: a bunch of ill-mannered little brats

words.definition: feeling or displaying no fear by temperament
words.verbal-illustration: undaunted despite their repeated failures at starting a business

words.definition: annoyed or angry
words.verbal-illustration: I was cross with her for being so careless

words.definition: to cause someone to be worried or upset
words.verbal-illustration: It perturbed him that his son was thinking about leaving school

words.definition: to look through (as a place) carefully or thoroughly in an effort to find or discover something
words.verbal-illustration: the owner of the bed-and-breakfast often trolls antique stores for furniture and knickknacks

words.definition: to proceed or move quickly
words.verbal-illustration: everyone scurried back to work as soon as they had finished their lunch in the cafeteria

words.definition: to move or act slowly
words.verbal-illustration: if you continue to dawdle, we'll be late for sure

words.definition: to make an irregular series of quick, sudden movements
words.verbalIllustration: the housefly darted about the room until it found an open window and flew out

words.definition: :to put up (a sign, notice, etc.) so that it can be seen by many people
words.verbalIllustration: The professor posted (up) the students's exam grades outside her office

words.definition: :to make (something) officially known to many people
words.verbalIllustration: The company posted increased profits for the third quarter.

words.definition: :to add (a message) to an online message board
words.verbalIllustration: She posts regularly to several newsgroups.

words.definition: :to assign (someone, such as a guard) to stand or stay at a particular place
:a piece of wood or metal that is set in an upright position into or on the ground especially as a support or marker
:to set (something) in a tightly closed position
words.verbalIllustration: His jaw clenched and unclenched as he listened to the speech.

words.definition: :to hold (something) tightly
words.verbalIllustration: She danced alone, with a rose clenched in her teeth.

words.definition: :the act or manner of holding
words.verbalIllustration: fearful that his suitcase might be stolen, he never once relaxed his clench on the handle

words.definition: :to have or keep in one's hands
words.verbalIllustration: clenched a tissue in his hands as he told his story of misfortune

words.definition: :to have or keep in one's hands
words.verbalIllustration: he clutched the eggs carefully so he wouldn't drop them

words.definition: :to fasten (something) with a clasp
words.verbalIllustration: He clasped the keys to his belt

words.definition: :to hold (someone or something) tightly with your hands or arms
